reviews.review_msg: Explains things very clearly, class participation and questions are integrated into this class. Did some cool demos too. Should be an easy class if you just do at least some practice questions every week. Class avg. on the midterm was something around 50-60% though

Mr. Emberly is a great prof. He undoubtedly does deserve a 100%, 5/5 star rating. Although the lectures could be a bit confusing at times, he undoubtedly did his best to engage us and teach the material. The lecture slides were built on so attending class is extremely important. His class notes I didn't find super important as I attended lectures.

not too difficult, mostly concepts form physics 11. very kind, approachable, no need to read the textbook. expect to spend about 2-3 hours on the weekly homework and maybe 1/2 hour on the written work. Midterms come straight from the textbook and theiclicker questions. as long as you can do every single one of those question you are golden.

nice guy, cares about students but very very boring. just make sure you pre-read before class or you won't understand anything he's talking about in lecture. honestly, i would've probably stopped showing up for class if it weren't for the clicker marks lol. overall, not a bad teacher just wish he was less boring.
He really cares about his students and he tries his best to accommodate to our needs. Some of his lectures can be difficult and full of hard examples from achieve.
don't do it.

I was hesitant taking this course with J-F because of the rating but happy I did. He does a good job at working through the problems during lecture and is very approchable. His tests are fair and there isn't too much homework or pre-reading you have to do. One of the only profs I've had book a room outside of class and do a study session for us.

I honestly don't really understand his low rating. JF is a really passionate prof, he's engaging during lectures, and I found his tests to be quite fair. in my honest opinion, there is far worse profs at SFU. He very rarely makes mistakes in his examples.

Jean-Francois started the year strong with a difficult first midterm. He spent a month focusing on 1D kinematics, before rapidly trying to rush through every other topic to catch back up. He often couldn't complete his own examples, he could not provide any clarity on the in class examples, and the lectures were useless to say the least. DONT TAKE!
worst prof at sfu

I'm ngl, all the negative reviewers are from first year kids that can't study or don't know uni yet. Course was not bad at all, exams were fair (including the final-you need to study everything for cumulative exams lol. he gave the ENTIRE class a 5% bonus for little effort. thats a full letter grade but nobody did it. 
hes great, caring, n helpful

He's a nice guy but terrible prof. The average for both midterms were low and the final was 48% and he refused scale or curve. Never have I seen or heard of averages this low for a Physics 12 class. He made this class so unnecessary hard and lectures were so pointless as he did random demos. If you can avoid taking with him I recommend doing so.

Average for both midterms were 55% and the final exam average was 48%. Both are super low considering it's physics 12. Final exam was extremely difficult. Questions did not make sense at all and were nothing like the samples, review questions gone over class, or assignments. Besides all those low averages and unfair exams this is not being scaled.

JFC is probably the worst prof I could have gotten this semester. He often gets confused by his own "explanations" and examples in class. After the final chapters were covered, he decided to do a unit on spreadsheets instead of review lectures. He seems like a nice professor, but I think he has trouble simplifying his physics knowledge.

He isn't too savvy when it comes to teaching as a whole but I think that he is good with one on onesâ€¦ his lectures aren't horrible but could use some work. I've gone to him once or twice in need of some help and both times he guided me to the correct solution. His worked examples could use some improvement (slower and clearer steps)
so horrible, made an easy class so hard, DO NOT take a class with this prof, trust me.

terrible. doesn't even know what he's teaching (ITS PHYS 12). final sm worse than expected. a lot of it was on stuff he never spent enough time teaching us (only 3 slides on a concept in lecture slides) and had ab 15 marks on the exam ab that. but willingly spent 2 weeks teaching us stuff not part of the course for what?? will never take him again!
awful. dont take

a very nice prof, however the midterm was not fair in difficulty but he always tries improving. I feel like he needs to find a more efficient way of teaching heavy material in only a 50 min time slot.

To cut a long review short, Prof. Caron gave confusing lectures and 1 to 2 large homework assignments per week, not including prelectures and bridge assignments. While the class isn't hard if you're good with numbers, he wasn't particularly forgiving when it came to poor marks. Also gave graded assignments on things that weren't part of the course.

Professor Caron is good. The class average for this first midterm was really low, so he made the second midterm wayyyy easier. He always does examples during class and is caring for students. He has changed the due dates for assignments multiple times because students were busy/had other work for their other classes; way nicer than other profs.

Sometimes confused at his own slides, and a notable portion of class time is spent on unnecessary but very cool demos of basic principles. Unconfident in lectures, but he does care about the students and has extended homework deadlines when most of the class had finals on the due date.
He's such a nice person, however he's not confident in how he teaches. But he's willing to adapt just not the best at teaching.

He gets confused at his own slides. He does a lot of demos and he'll say "lets hope I can do this properly" but then "oh that wasn't supposed to happen" when it doesn't go as expected. You'll prolly have to learn the material on your own because his lectures don't make sense. If you alr struggle with physics you'll find this class quite difficult.

He's an average/above average physics prof. I can't speak for phys102, but if you put in a little bit of time for phys 100, he's really not horrible. Y'all just can't do physics and blame the prof. lol

overcomplicates everything. refuses to take criticism. does questions that aren't even relevant to the course.
MADE MULTIPLE MISTAKES ON THE MIDTERM AND TOOK OFF A POINT FOR USING WHAT WAS ORIGINALLY IN THE QUESTION. HOW DOES THAT EVEN MAKE SENSE-
confuses himself which is baffling to me (he literally makes the slides and questions himself)

The start of the semester was a bit hard, but Prof. Caron is honestly trying his best to make the class better and I think it is working. He made a survey asking what we liked and what we did not like about lectures/his teaching and I think that helped.

Not as bad as people make him out to be. Physics will always need to be practiced and self taught. People just don't know that when they come into the class. I would say he is slightly above average, and cares about making the class better. Just be ready to read the textbook and review pre- and post-class. Also remember first years like to complain
JF is the worst professor in the history of physics.
They removed half the ratings and it's already back up to 60 awful. He would've had 100 awfuls by nowâ€¦.. let that speak for itself

This class is the sole reason for my stress right now. He is genuinely the WORST professor here I suggest anyone planning to take a physics course to wait for a semester instead of taking it with him. He is more clueless than Dora looking for a monument.

Man, lots of homework (lots of which is out of the scope of the course, or too difficult). Even he acknowledges the difficulty of the homework, but provides no help or real substance as to how to even go about solving it. The class has been a lot of grade 11 physics- when a greater portion of the class can't even understand the simple stuff idk....

Don't take a class with this guy, he struggles at teaching concepts properly and lectures are a waste of time as he goes over things that are not important at all. He confuses himself with his own notes and has to backtrack what he's saying half the time. Lectures aren't helpful, you will learn this entire course on your own.
All the actual reviews got taken down. There used to be way more awful ratings. JF you're not slick
They removed half the bad reviews and kept the false good ones. Don't be fooled there used to be 70 awful ratings and they were all fair.
I'm no physicist, but I got a 91 on the midterm which has to be due to JF's teaching styles and techniques. Very impressed with his ability to convey concepts and material.

I honestly just wish he was aware of how bad he is. The concepts covered in homework and exam are so complex and outside of his minimal teaching material that a student is left in shambles trying to figure out how to complete the work. His lectures are just useless as well. Please JFC, acknowledge the damage you're doing to your physics students
Someone needs to teach him how to teach

This class is honestly not bad at all everyone saying he is awful is being kinda dramatic. Yes, the amount of homework can be a lot and the exam could be considered difficult but he's an average prof and the class is average difficulty.

He gives a decent amount of homework per week but it helps prepare for exams. Sometimes lecture examples can be a bit confusing but the slides are useful. Exam kinda long but the difficulty of questions was fair for what we learned and what was on the practice midterm and in the homework.
literally the definition of the blind leading the blind. bro seems like he doesnt know what hes doing especially during lecture.

Horrible experience with this professor, avoid his class if possible. His lecture notes are a mess and include almost no coherent thoughts or lessons. Midterm was horrible, the time is split between individual and partner portions (for the latter you only get 30 minutes which leaves no discussion time or time to actually do the question).

This man is the most disorganized teacher I have ever had in my career as a student. Dont get me wrong, hes a good guy but I wish i could say the same as teacher. It seems like he comes to lectures not prepared/comfortable with the material (even the midterm had mistakes in it). Advice: avoid him at all costs, take the online equivalent if you can.

Words can't explain how awful this guy is. If there was a rating that went to 0 I'd use that. His teaching ability is so poor that you can't even call it teaching. Seeing him solving HIS OWN questions makes me doubt his knowledge of the subject. Physics 100 is a Grade 12 equivalent course and he isn't able to solve the questions. Let that sink in
So horrible, he doesn't even know what he's teaching himself, his class is not curved and his tests are ridiculously hard. If he is teaching the class DO NOT take it!

Resources provided do give appropriate content for exams, he lets us use cheat sheets, overall NOT THAT BAD. He seems like a nice guy. The issue i find is that in lecture, he focuses more on conceptual understanding rather than application, and because his own knowledge of physics is so high, I think he has trouble bringing it down to a gr12 level.

The midterm consisted of questions completely different than what we learnt in lectures/assignments. Instead of giving the full hour and 40 mins to do the midterm, he gives us 1 hour 10mins then we have to do the midterm again but with a partner for 30 mins. It was not enough time for anybody. Rather have whole time for midterm than in groups.

He's an extremely nice person, but as a teacher he is awful on a different level. I've never come across someone so uncoordinated, and so lost at his pay grade. The school must truly reconsider their lecturers if they choose to allow him to teach a course. He makes mistakes on tests nor does he prepare you for them! He simply does a demo!
One of the best profs at SFU!

This professor is one of the worst instructors at SFU. I have a degree in Business and was coming back to school to complete med school pre-reqs and this guy is without a doubt the worst prof I've ever had. I ended up dropping the course. After seeing the comments from last semester, I'm really glad I did. Avoid him at all costs, he doesn't teach.
Great prof and he is funny. Intersting class,and the content is not very hard. Eassy to follow. Exams are fair, but with too many quizs. or maybe a bit too much hw. I like the way he teachs
Terrible prof, we learnt almost nothing in class yet the assignments and final were so hard
Worst professor ever, avoid at all costs! You will not get your money's worth from this guy.
Jungic? I think the guy below means Alberding. Anyways, everything else I completely agree: WORST PROFESSOR EVER!

Whoever gave this guy 100% is completely inaccurate (I won't be surprise if Alberding wrote that evaluation himself). Final exam average was 55% this semester! 55% for a 100-level course. Alberding is a horrible lecturer who doesn't teach. ENOUGH SAID.
Sorry, but I have to disagree with the evaluation below - Dr. Jungic is a poor lecturer who doesn't teach and everything you learn is self-taught. Worst prof I ever had PERIOD.
The assignments and labs are quite easy. Lectures are so so. Anyway, Neil is a good lecturer.

Worst. Prof. EVER. Will not teach you a thing, but will demonstrate friction by making you watch an asian guy pull a truck with his ear. Or watch Romeo and Juliet physics jokes. Did not learn a thing, except ears are strong
Absolutely horrendous teaching. Do not take Phys 100 with this prof you will absolutely regret it.

He starts off slowly explaining the most basic high school physics concepts and then rushes through the rest, barely explaining anything. The assignments are about 2 weeks ahead of the material taught in lecture, so you are basically on your own, and MUST learn everything from the textbook. Lectures are useless, most people skip them.

Three words: HE DOESN'T TEACH. He tries to keep you entertained with live physics experiments in class, but they quickly get old as quizzes, assignments and the final begin to close in. Expect to learn on your own and don't expect much from his lectures.

Dr. Alberding may be a nice guy, but his lectures are horrible: expect to learn on your own as he is prone fall behind on material (goes slow on easy stuff and rushes through hard topics), provide poor explanations and assign HW on topics he has not covered in class yet. AVOID HIM IF YOU CAN and pray you don't have him for higher level physics.
Highly Recommended. Students with previous interest in physics might want a more challenging teacher.

Unless he starts testing you on loony toons, the classes are useless. Often times when doing an example, he will make a mistake and a student will have to point it out. He tries to correct it, screws up more. Then gives up and says "well its obvious you can figure it out yourself."
Lectures are really pointless to go to, you dont learn much from it or "the motion chronicles", understand the hw and go to tutorials, basically teach yourself and you'll survive the class.
For the quiz & exam:95% of the lec is useless, 70% of the text book is useless, 80% of the lab is useless, 200%!! of the homework is important, 200%!! of the TUT is important!!

His lectures are amusing, but I didn't learn much from them. There are lots of interesting demos during class. His marking scheme was fair tho, no midterms, only 6 quizes, homework, and a final. But you might need some extra study guides to learn from, the "Motion Chronicals" is a piece of junk.
very easy class..make sure u go to the open lab, and understand all assignments, quizes, and sample exams...then, u'll get a good mark..

Be prepared to learn 90 percent of the material on your own from a supplementary text book and/or a tutor, because lectures do not adequately cover problem solving, or necessary formulas. The material in this course isn't particularly difficult, but it is difficult to do well from lectures and course materials alone.

He does have rather interesting/ funny demonstrations, but his use of extra materials (eg. roadrunner cartoons) eats up time we could be using to actually take notes and write down equations to help us with the homework. I don't feel that his teaching has prepared me for physics 101 at all nor a chance to get a good mark in the class.
Funny guy, he wouldn't let me borrow the powers of 10 video though! Entertainment value rises, sophisticated, suave and well.

Awesome and dedicated prof.  He brings in just to explain a lecture!!! how many profs would go out of their way to do that???  He prepares you really well for further physics courses but this course is overall really subject matter so the amount of time you put into this class will be MUCH less than what you should put into future phy classes!
very entertaining prof and the grading scale will boost up your mark significantly... found it to be completely useless though
although he was nice enough, and helpful. i found his class to be useless. i acheived a B+ in this class and went on to receive a D in phys 101. i learned NOTHING
Dr. Alberding is such a nice person. If you are polite and nice to him, he is always willing to help. Besides, if neone can make physics fun, that on its own is spectacular.
No Comments
Brings in other forms of media to relate into the course
He is just awesome~ hilarious-check mark, easy-check mark, informative-check mark~ u will love him
Best physics prof ...hilarious, and he doesn't give out midterms b/c unlike most profs he actually cares about our stress level!
Awesome!  Funny and informative!  Easy to learn from!
He's the funniest prof I've ever met. I took this course long ago and he still remembers me. He has offered to help me in many occations even though he isn't teaching that particular course!
my favourite prof so far, he interacts with the students and has a ton of hilarious demos!
One word to descibe " AweSome!"
Funny prof. Good lectures.
Less videos = understanding
He shows too many videos~ should spend more time to show the class how to do different types of problems instead. A fair prof, if u study then u should get a decent mark. PS: He is very funny though
his beeping hat and his bat mobile is worth a laugh.. he's great in the tutorial but i wish he shows less videos and more examples to calculate stuff in class
No Comments
No Comments
Very funny, hair is great, but notes are bad and lectures are boring. Easy class though
Neil's coo... hes so funny... Lots of demos.
No Comments
No Comments
crazy but very nice & funny guy
lectures were really unclear but he's a nice guy overall, go in for extra help
Could have more notes.  Better text would be nice.  Pretty awesome person.
Great little guy.
Great in the Lab... too disorganized in the Lecture
interesting and good prof (a real nerd) but cool anyway!
super sweet and doesnt go too fast. Definitely recommend, she explains things well :). Also tries to help as much as possible with examples and office hours and review sessions.
this course wasn't hard at all, she made good explanations and was very clear on what would be on tests. there was no midterm and marking was very fair. attend lectures because she uses iClicker
pretty easy A, just attend lectures, every week homework and pretty hard, but midterms and finals are not that hard once you finish the prep materials

Dr Johnson is actually an adequate prof. I found her explanations easy to understand, tests were fair (no midterm) and final was fair as well. She never made any trick questions and was clear on her expectations for the class

I hate physics but Dr. J made it bearable (enjoyable, even!). She loves physics which translates to her teaching. Lecture slides are easy to understand and light, and she does lots of examples in class. Practice midterms and exam are very similar to the real thing. Lots of homework, but doable. She is so sweet, I definitely recommend her classes!

There's a lot of homework but I suggest redoing achieve questions to practice for her exams. Professor Johnson is a good professor and she is clearly very passionate in what she does and I strongly suggest taking a class with her if you can.
He gets very moody and very demanding. One of the worst courses/professor pairings I have ever had.

I'd say he's a funny person, great dad. But as a professor the method he teach might not be for everyone, you HAVE TO READ and UNDERSTAND the textbook and that is. Don't rely on what he teach in class it way different in the exam. You have to pass all the midterms, do all the class assignment and homework and finish his final project.
BEST PROFESSOR AT FIC. DON'T BELIEVE THE OTHER REVIEWS. HE IS AN AMAZING PERSON.
Many people complain about Peter but I sincerely believe that in general they have not seen that physics is always a intensive course and requires discipline. Not everything is rosy.
Not recommended. Instead of instructing, he is attempting to prove the formula. Be prepared to check everything on moodle yourself before the lesson and to have a thorough understanding of physics.
he is a nice person, yet not a nice professor, won't recommend to others

Peter Smith is an OK professor overall, his lectures are no other than explain how is a formula formed and never do test like question in class. They are reserved for the homework in which we never receive feedback or and answer key. He likes to do jokes. Though outside class he is pretty nice.

He does not teach well, he gives too many breaks during class, everytime his son cries he gives a break, he does not answer questions, he does not replies to emails, does not solve any problem  in class, he puts us in breakout rooms to do assignments but he does not give clear directions, he has not graded any of my quizzes and we are almost finish

Very boring class, doesn't teach well. First time taking physics, but it felt pretty difficult and I was unable to understand anything in class, so if you're confident in self-studying you can try this course. He doesn't seem very friendly either- there have been some occasions where he yelled/ was rude to students in my class. Wouldn't recommend.
Excellent prof

Excellent prof. He showed a great interest in this course. Assignment is very easy, marking is fair. He explained very things so clearly and exam is absolutely doable. Take his course if you want to boost your GPA.

i have not  seen a bad prof like him.he sometimes put his emotion in the class, when he was happy, he may help you with Qs, if not, he may just dont answer it and ask you to figure it out yourself. try not to take his class by all means.

He's an okay prof, although I really learned more by reading the textbook than from him, to be honest.  Like others have said, he has some difficulty with clarity and most of his notes are just directly from the textbook.  His paragraph-format notes make it hard to concentrate too.  Attendance = Must due to iClicker questions.

He is a very very very bad teacher. The course is not that hard, but he makes it like a 300 level course. And his office hr is useless at all. People do not like to go to his office hrs. Because all the TAs have better ability to explain the Qs that you ask.

He is good at explaining things one-on-one and definitely has an interest in physics; however, teaching is not his strong point. Homework is due before he teaches it which means you teach yourself. It felt like a correspondence course.

Funny, cool guy, only helpful one to one. Other than that he is a horrible prof. He takes notes from the textbook and complicates it more and is very poor in explaining the simplest concepts. Unless you are able to teach yourself the concepts it is hard to do good on the exams and have a good understanding of the course. Do not recommend him

He's a joke. Has a lot of trouble answering basic questions, constantly gets flustered during lecture and is always making mistakes and erasing large parts of the notes he's just made (which are all copied directly out of the textbook btw) A little bit more helpful one on one, but I'd avoid this guy.

Cool guy, but as a professor, needs to be more clear when explaining concepts. Found that he like to throw out and break down formulas to try and answer your question. Know your formulas and you should be fine! Very helpful during office hours.
He is good and provides formula sheets for mid and final. A lot of assignment to do.
very humorous. much homework to do
Has a hard time explaining the concepts and fumbles around when students ask basic questions. Has a really difficult time clarifying even the most basic of concepts.
He's absolutely useless. He copies everything straight from the text, but doesn't explain it properly. You're better off skipping his lectures and just reading all  of the text book.

I had little to no knowledge about physics, and I failed my first midterm with McGuirk. I realized I just wasn't focusing enough in his lectures, so I did every example in his slides, over and over again, ended up with an A! With Jeff, his exams were literally copy and paste from his lecture clickers, with a few harder written questions.

jeff is one of the nicest professors that I have had so far! He was super funny and always made the entire class laugh. He went pretty quickly during lectures, but everything was posted after so you always were able to go back. Exams were simple, just make sure your practice, practice, practice! Trust me it makes all the difference in any course.

Jeff is a really good prof. He has a funny sense of humour, is organized, answers questions and emails. His exams are pretty fair imo if you study for them diligently. Toughest part is the multiple choice sections of his exams because they are conceptual and require a pretty good understanding of the ideas of physics rather than the calculations.

Jeff lectures are super funny and enjoyable. You can tell he really cares and wants his class to succeed. Homework and exams are based off lectures and are very fair. He really puts a effort in to make sure people understand the material. He's a very good prof and explains the material very well.

Jeff is really responsible and funny to make stuff easier to understand. He distributed the lecture contents, online homework and lab materials properly so that Im able to connect them together, enhancing my understanding of the course. The learning experience with Jeff is awesome and definitely I would recommend his lectures.

The first thing I noticed about Jeff is that he genuinely wants his students to succeed. He is readily available outside of class and makes the best attempt he can to answer questions (no matter how stupid). He is willing to drop bad midterms if you do well on the final and he does really good lectures. I would take him again in a heartbeat.
Just redo online homework questions and read through lecture slides before midterms or finals, you will be fine...

Really good class although concepts add up quickly. I would recommend going over the practice questions on your own after each lecture. When you understand them it seems simple but if you don't you will be completely lost as each class builds on the previous. Lots of time for midterms and beware of wording in multiple choice questions.

Jeff is an amazing professor. He is super passionate about physics and seems to make it his life goal to get his students to be passionate about physics. Available outside of class for help. His homework is always very helpful and relevant to the material and if you practice lots you can do well on the exams. Really nice guy!
exams were brutally hard. lectures were all over the place and notes were really informal and not clear enough
Awesome, laid-back professor. Study off the textbook and you'll find the midterm and final exam easy.
tough exams. mastering physics questions are long and tedious. ended up hating physics. nice guy though
Tough exams
horribly hard exams. textbook is an essential as it is much better at explaining the material

He's a pretty nice guy but if you miss even one or two lectures you'll be so behind. He posts notes online but if you're not there in class it's a little hard to understand what he was trying to explain. His exams are nothing like what he assigns for homework. Other than that hes decent but definetly not the best and you can only pray that you pass
Extremely hard final and midterms. Be prepared to memorize everything. Practice wont help, has a habit of tricking people.
tough exams. nice person
nice guy. I don't want to say he is a great professor because sometimes he is not that clear. Midterms have been horribly tough. Textbook was the only thing that kept me going in this class.
Hilarious, engages students, writes out notes so everyone is at same pace then posts them online. Nice guy, though his marking and exams are tough. Makes physics more interesting.
Great professor, very helpful and frequently lightens the mood in class which is nice

Awesome professor, great explanatory skills, and fun lectures. Always willing to help & made learning physics enjoyable. He seems to very much like teaching which is why he's really good at it. A lot of clicker Q's

My favourite prof I have met thus far.  Jeff is such a sweetheart and his lectures are super clear. Don't forget your i-Clicker! Easy participation marks.  He has light humor as he writes, and is super helpful in office hours.  It is clear that he loves Physics and wants his students not to be afraid of it. I hope to take a class with him again!

Very helpful, explains concepts in simple terms. I dropped out of high school physics, but this prof helped me understand, and I got an A-. Keep your notes and Mastering Physics questions, since many will show up in Phys 101. Make sure you read through all of the practise final questions and solutions- the real final is hard, but easier than these.

Very good professor! Might be one of the best I've had at SFU so far. He's very helpful, clear and concise about his lessons. If you're unclear of anything, it helps to read the textbook but otherwise his lectures are always interesting. Grading was fair, but I did think the final was very hard in comparison. Overall GREAT prof!
BIG MACCC....McGUIRRKKKKKK.. Champ. Best physics prof ever.

Very helpful lecturer. Very passionate in what he taught and wanted the students to succeed until you get his exams, which are damn hard. Final exam was much harder than anything on the midterms. Midterms were relatively fair, but required quite a bit of studying. Worst part were the online assignments, some questions were not relevant at all
Very helpful prof! midterms are fair but his final was damn hard! study hard
i dont know why everyone is complaining. i have him this semester and he is extremely helpful. the midterms are so similar to the practice tests + HE GENUINELY CARES!!
Good teacher

Not as bad as what I thought. He did get confused in the middle of a question every now and then but it wasn't too difficult to get back on the right track. And even if you were still confused he probably has unlimited office hours so you can always pop by and ask him!
Very good prof!

He's not the clearest when it comes to teaching and once or twice you might get lost in what he is saying. However, he genuinely  cares for  the students and wants them to do well. He gave quite a few bonus mark questions here and there and was surprisingly generous assigning final grades.
Very friendly prof but has difficulty teaching the class. He babies the class through lecture and then hits you with a bomb when you take the tests. For a grade 12 equivalent course it is very tough.

100 iClicker questions in one semester (some points are for attendance though). He tries to be funny which I find amusing. His accent is interesting but understand-able if you try. He also has 2 grading schemes and uses whichever one gives you a better grade.

He's always available to help, even outside of office hours. He also tries to crack jokes from time to time. Personally, i didn't find his accent that bad as I always understood what he was trying to say. I overall enjoyed the class. He was one of the better profs i had that semester. He scales as well, depending on the marks.
He is always available and ready to help. Probably one of the nicest profs I've had, but his lectures are not entirely related to the material on the tests and the tests are HARD.
Nice guy but cannot teach to save his life. Tests are insanely long and pretty difficult.

He's a nice prof and all... but very hard to understand. Lectures seem to be disorganized, his notes are hard to follow and understand. Material on assignments are completely different from the material on the tests. If you don't need this course... don't take it.

Here's an analogy: He teaches you how to add 2 and 6 together. Then he gives you assignments and expects you to integrate the equation. Assignments and exams are extremely hard. His notes often touch on the basics of the subject, and you're expected to apply it with other theorems and laws. Very confusing and would not take a class with him again

I  would not recommend taking this class if you do not have a basic understanding of physics. It is supposed to be an intro course that those who have never taken physics can take but it is extremely difficult. He is unclear and his tests have way too many q's for 50 mins. However, he is accomodating and tries to help if you go to his office hours.
Unclear. Means well. But very unclear. If the content of the course was challenging, everyone would drown.

Extremely confusing. Tries to help but ends up making it more confusing - focus on the textbook. Way too many questions for a 50 minute midterm, knowing that students have been doing physics for a total of 4 WEEKS!! tells you to plainly accept the methods instead of teaching why. avoid at all costs, physics for me is kind of ruined

Decent prof with good intentions, you could tell he wants his students to learn and do well. Gives lots and lots of bonus marks. If you go to the open labs and all the lectures its really hard to fail. would definitely take another course with this prof.
Nice guy hard course. Final was too hard.
Extremely helpful, though sometimes he rambles on and can make things confusing. He's ok, but definitely not an easy A.

Not a good prof. Notes are confusing he often gets confused himself during lectures. cannot complete his own practice questions without making mistakes. BEWARE final exam was extremely DIFFICULT. However he is willing to help as much as possible. but he will still confuse you during office hours since he just does not have a good teaching ability

Really nice guy with infinite office hours, open to suggestions and tries to keep class interesting.  However, his accent is heavy, he is muddled and makes mistakes and often isn't very clear.  The difficulty of his tests varied: first one was horrid, second was *too* easy and the final was even worse than the first one.  Not a gpa booster with him
His notes often differ from the textbook. Makes mistakes in class. And the final was crazy difficult. It was nothing like the midterms, assignments, or practice questions
He's a really nice guy, loves to help his students and sincerely wants them to pass; however, he has an accent, and nobody can really understand him because he's just so confusing...

He is an amazing prof. He cares for his students and goes out of his way to help us if we need it. He explains things very well and if we're confused about a concept, he will always elaborate until we understand. Not only is he a good prof but he's incredibly funny as well. 100% would take his class again, wish he would teach all physic courses
Funny guy, makes lecture not boring. Very approachable and friendly!

Rasoul is an amazing professor, he really cares about his students and is always available to help outside of class. He takes students' opinions into account and tries to bring material into class that we have said we need most help with. Going to his office hours was super helpful and fun as well, he makes the subject interesting.
Rasoul, is one of the nicest prof I ever had. He is always available for help and he gave our class group midterms which really helped boost our marks.

I was scared for all the comments I saw in this website. However, he is a very good proof. Hilarious and very sarcastic. If you do bad in the midterm but well in the final, he'll automatically replace the midterm grade for the final grade. He's a messy writer, makes few mistakes, lots of clicker Q's and pretty cool experiments in lecture.

Lectures are always involving the solving of problems. Pretty good at explaining, except sometimes he could be better at highlighting important formulas students will be heavily using throughout the chapter. Overall, good choice of a teacher.

B/c this is phys, you have to understand! don't expect to just go to lec and then be able to do the hw and exams! practice!! good teacher and a nice guy. Lecs allowed you to learn the basis of everything. go to workshops if u need Sometimes he's disorganized and forgets to turn the screen to his paper but that's good comic relief from physics lool

Honestly, in the beginning of the term I hated him so much because the lack of organization. But now that it is the end of the term, he's actually a really good professor... He's very different in the way he teaches the class, his examples are easy to relate or try to understand. Would love to have him again.
Actual cares about whether we understand concepts or not, goes over things that we request him to, awesome professor overall. Definitely would take a course specifically if he was teaching it.

I thought that he explained the concepts well, and provided interesting examples/demos. I don't think he's as bad as some others say, although the active learning lab wasn't very coordinated. At the end of the semester, we ran out of time, and spent very little time on the last couple topics (optics and magnetic forces).

His multiple choice questions are super unreasonably tricky. He goes over tons of useful material and his tests are not hard and are based on the material covered in lectures, except multiple choice questions, these are just horrible.

Messy writing, homework is much harder than what he covers in class. Lecture to be honest isn't a must but he has Iclicker questions which force you to go. Makes lots of mistakes in his solutions. Practice exams do not reflect his actual exams.

He assigns a lot of homework and you have to take time every week to spend an hour in the "active learning lab" that is completely useless and a waste of time. All the homework (hours upon hours) plus the active learning lab and weekly written homework assignments add up to only 10% of your grade. The rest is midterms and finals. Don't recommend

He makes mistakes in his examples sometimes and is very bad at following up with things. For example, he doesn't reply to emails directly, despite even replying on time. You have to go to him face-to-face so that he can't escape, for him to help you out. -.- seriously... didn't remember to show up for an arranged office hour meeting either...

He didn't finish teaching material in the course so he just cut it out, which is troublesome if you need to take further physics courses. Assigns homework almost every week for marks but they have little relevance to the lecture. Makes many mistakes during lectures that students have had to point out. Doesn't answer questions in lecture clearly.
he's ok. Not bad but not great, there have been quite a few times where he makes mistakes in the notes nd students have to correct him.

His lectures are clear. His notes are clear. The text we are using is free (online). He does not muddle his class with the complicated stuff. He teaches you the basics and expects you to take the necessary steps to complete the homework. He is a good teacher. The 'active learning labs' are useless.

For the midterms make sure to focus on the iclicker and mastering physics questions! Final is more similar to the textbook questions. Overall, it was an easy course, just pay attention to his notes and do the homework and you'll be fine!
Really nice professor. Gives clear and understandable notes. Questions done in class and for homework is highly representative for what you'll see/should expect on exams.

He gives an insane amount of homework, and all the questions are really hard. In class he goes over the easiest stuff, making the homework nearly impossible. His exams are also really tough, and its really difficult to finsih them in the 50 minutes you get. He is really boring, tough, and his notes are also really messy. AVOID THIS GUY AT ALL COSTS

just a warning... I had him as a prof a few years ago....and when I went to him for help because I thought he made a mistake in his notes, he told me that I shouldn't be taking the class if I didn't understand it.  Of course everyone knows you need it for any science major! then he proceeded to talk about how smart his son is! I thought he was horr

He's a very nice teacher who made me love physics. His notes were very clear and I hardly have any questions to ask him at all. His midterms are decent and understandable as long as you do the majority of the textbook questions.
No Comments
Talk about a prof who does not want to be teaching and it shows a lot. Very pour.

He warned us continually about the horrible textbook, "The Motion Chronicles". I didn't like it that he said, don't call, don't e-mail me, talk to your TA (who had 2 min between classes), and everyone swarmed him after classes (because they didn't understand). No one asked questions. No one got the answers. He was there, but I was in another class

Seriously, Prof. Watkins is probably the most overrated professor on this site. He's NOT a good teacher, he makes a lot of mistakes in his notes are very simple examples. You cannot study for an exam or do the loncapa with his notes. Avoid this prof at all costs. Who knows, he might've been good a few years ago, but he sucks major ass now.

He is very boring, messy hand writing, good examples but hard to understand, notes from webct is unreadable, midterm extreamly hard (class avg 50-60 for all 3), loncapa really hard. IMO, he can't teach. If you want to pull your GPA or CGPA down, take him, else STAY far away.
He is very helpful and really nice, loncapa is very hard, exams=very hard, but if need his help just ask for it and he'll be there for you!
A fantastic prof! i came into phys thinkin this class is gonna be hell and turned out to be my best class! soo good at teaching! if u pay attention and try in his class you will get a B forsure!
all over the place jumps from concepts, gives difficult assignments  but does not cover material properly in lecture. Gives assignment even in exam weeks:( I want my $ back.

This guy is the best physics prof that you can get in a life time! I've been to both SFU and UBC and I can clearly tell he is the best! SIMPLY THE BEST! As for easiness, it's hard to say, because if you study his course is easy, and if you don't it's not. But I think he is pretty fair in marking. He deserves a big gold medal for his teaching method
Really good prof!!! His lectures were really clear and well laid out. Definitely approachable and willing to help!  His exams are fair too! just pay attention in class and you'll do fine.

he was the assistant prof for this course. he was pretty approachable and is really good with giving help when you need it.  the text for this was really bad though. i suggest finding a first year text in the library to study off of.
I have no idea how I passed, good thing is that he curves. His explanations during class were never clear to me, I didn't understand anything at all.

Makes you really question if anything related to science is worth it. Not the greatest at explaining most concepts and gets triggered if students dont fully grasp the concept the first time. Likes to ask the students questions during zoom classes which only creates an awkward silence in the already painful and confusing class

Girt is a kind prof (hence the 2/5) but he really needs to be more organized. I understand that teaching physics 100 is relatively new to him, however he should've been better prepared and be more willing to take on questions from his students.

I did relatively well in Phys11 and just needed the Phys 12 credit, thinking this would be a breeze. Really isn't. He seems caring about his students, but does not answer his emails, and his exams were nothing like what we have done in class. They are exponentially harder, even for an online exam. Not fair if you do not cheat and are honest :(

While he really is a fun and caring person, what makes this class difficult is that he is very inaccessible. In the first week, he stated that he won't be checking any emails because there are too many students. The lectures are fine, except he includes problems from a higher-level course, which doesn't help.
pretty good prof he explains things really well just do the practice exams because they are exactly like the actual exams

I stopped going to lectures cuz genuinely his tone of voice would put me to sleep. all his midterms and finals are practically identical to his old 2018 practice ones so study those and you will do good. his lectures are optional for a reason. I stopped going and taught myself the material and it worked better for me.

very good prof for phys 100. found the exams rather straightforward. as long as you do the sampling practice and keep on top of the readings you're going to do fine. Material is straightforward and it is phys so need to obviously practice some questions as well.
Lectures are quite confusing, does not go over solution of examples clearly and just posts the summary. Office hours before exams are hardly any help

He is hilarious and quite the quirky guy. While I did have to teach myself the material, the concepts are pretty straight forward. He held office hours the day before every midterm and would stop during lectures to take questions. His tests are fair as long as you study and understand the examples discussed in lecture and tutorial.

His lectures are long and hard to follow, his examples are unclear and he goes through everything too quickly. He may be better in person, but due to COVID, and online lectures, this has been an awful experience. I asked him for help, and he then asked me if I could drop out. That should be enuf.

Although he has a thick accent, Dr. Chen is still an amazing prof. His lectures are very clear and he encourages people to ask questions to make concepts more clear. Always stays after class to answer any questions. Exams were straightforward and fair. He is also very funny.

Michael really knows what hes talking about except I would really appreciate it if he explained material in a clear and concise manner instead of mumbling about random theory in between explaining basic concepts/equations. Most problems are already completed via powerpoint so it's hard to follow along.

Michael reuses a lot of questions in his exams. Studying his lecture slides and understanding the questions he goes through is enough for this class. His classes were fun, although he gets distracted easily. He moved slowly through concepts, and made them easy to understand. If you're able to do assignments and homework without help, you'll be fine
Lectures are easy to understand, most info to study for midterms & finals are on the lecture sides. Lab & assignments are relatively easy.

I was always terrified of physics because I didn't feel that I did well in the subject in high school. However, Dr. Chen did a great job explaining concepts and gave hints about the exams. By repeatedly going over difficult topics and by making the class enjoyable, I found myself much more confident about taking my next physics course!

He's HILARIOUS without trying. Makes physics enjoyable. Literally brought a barbie doll to lecture, put it on a Van de Graaff generator, and poked at it's hair with a stick. Made my day. He rambles a lot so lectures can get boring and hard to follow, but the assignments and labs are super helpful and if you do those you should get a decent mark!

Very nice Prof, his lecture slides were helpful and he posts the answers to lecture questions on Canvas. I highly recommend going to his office hours because he's really good at explaining various problems in detail.  His tests were fairly easy because he would mention what to expect on the exam, which questions to take note of, etc.

1. Heavy chinese accent, i mean HONGKONG  style english!! 2. 50-60 years old guy, midterm is pretty hard, especially for PHYS 100 this introductory course. I have taken High school physics 12 then drop it, hard to catch up lots of homework Would recommend to take another prof if possible, well there isn't that much good physics prof here at SFU....

Not very good at explaining concepts! He is all over the place and sometimes gets lost himself. He tries to be funny which is refreshing, and if you do the practice problems you will do well, but lectures are confusing!

although u will get stupid mastering physics, it helps quite a lot. this prof is slow, very slow, he makes sure everyone gets it before he moves on, good prof. Mideterms are fair, time is fairly sufficient. and the final, a combination of exact midterm questions, iclicker questions, mastering physics and A LOT of questions from sample final.
Easy exams - straight from hw. Give out good notes and examples. Barely used the book.
Great prof, emphasis on concepts > examples. As long as you understand 'why' you will do fine.
His Chinese accent isn't too heavy. He has a unique sense of humour. The lecture hall is huge and just avoid annoying group of people that you often see.
so clear, even with an accent... I only studied his notes and I got a pretty high mark... You can't skip his lectures though since he doesn't post his notes online
Useless class lectures, EXTREMELY easy exams... i rarely even go to classes.. just studied off on my own
BOOOORING
Sooooo boring but it's also very easy if you have a decent background in physics from highschool. Put me to sleep many times.

Easy examples on lecture notes but totally different loncapa questions.  Expect u to know BCD afta he taught u A, Midterm avg r not high...but the great thing was he weight heavily on the final, which you have more time to do the exam...Midterm avg was failing b4, but afta final, i got b+, so dun get frustrated if he gets you on midterms

hmm..maybe it's because I don't like physics...but i hated his class. Too boring...and very easy examples in his notes...very different compared to loncapa questions. But if you go for help, he would gladly explain it to you.

spends too much time solving equations and not enough time on the concepts!! Then wonders why his students spit back the equations!!  Midterms straight forward/As he stated, final was more difficult/Nice guy, really cares/

to be fair, yes it is sometimes hard to understand what he is saying. ppl complain his lectures arent totally connected to the capa. the problem is ppl rely too much on number crunching to solve capa. when you answer written q's on his exams, write out the full solution and not just 1 or 2 steps. overall a decent prof.

this man cannot except the fact that there is more than one method to solve questions using the laws of physics.  It's his way or the highway but the problem is his way doesnt make sense and is very unorganized. Lectures are useless and enjoys going on powertrips.

Unorganized. Half the time, the assignments have absolutely NO relation to the lectures -- this is crucial since the lecture notes are highly needed since the textbook makes no sense. His lectures don't "flow", the labs are useless (and mandatory), the TAs in the open lab are essential for success in this class -- and they're great by the way.
Good, Fair proff.
worts teacher i have had a uviversity.  very unclear.  i doubt he knows what he is talking about
Assumes a lot of prior info, doesn't like answering questions, might refuse to
Stay Away

I like Simin as a person, however her teaching skills lack, horribly. Most of Physics 100 was done by self teaching myself. She loves to trick you on the multiple choice for the exams. I have taken her for Physics 100 and will not make the same mistake for Physics 101.

this class was fully online and it did not do her any favours. she tended to run out of time during the lecture and couldn't go over all of the material. i also thought that she wasn't clear and specific when answering questions. textbook lowkey sucks. make sure to practice and study lots if you're not good at physics (like me)!! [fall 2021]

There's lots of free marks for Iclicker, pre-lecture Q's, and (difficult) weekly Achieve assignments, but I found the volume of all these free marks left me very little time to actually read & understand the textbook. I also really hate courses that force us to use Achieve. I think it's a bad textbook. she's nice, but this learning style wasnt 4 me
Professor Najmi is a good professor. Physics can get really confusing but she is good at clarifying things when asked. She is also good at taking all questions.
Simin was great prof, she explained the topics thoroughly. Make sure to practice a lot well in the midterms and final.
Good lectures, she answers a lot of questions. She had some technical difficulties online but it was nothing significant. Does a good job explaining concepts.

Simin takes a hard course and makes it into an easy course. She has wonderful lectures from start to finish. She knows everything she is talking about and her lectures have the best iclicker's - very easy and show you how to apply most of the concepts as they come up. She will never make a trick question and even says I am not here to trick you

Lectures are online this year and on zoom, and every lecture we've had technical issues that take up a chunk of the 50 minutes to fix. Honestly feel like each lecture we have 30 mins of actual material learned and even then it feels rushed or hard to understand with her notes. Feel like I have to look at external sources to learn more than in class

Not much help available, i used to tutor physics 11 and everything covered in the course is explained much more complicated than needed. Subjects not fully covered in lecture and examples are way easier than actual assignments.
She is very kind and respected. Her lectures are easy and balanced.

Great Prof!! teaches like a highschool teacher... good notes and easy iclickers. I never liked physics and wasnt that great at it but got a B+. exams are straight forward and multiple choice is exactly like iclickers. i recommend her:)

great proff keps everything simple and concise she posts lectures online they are a bit more clear than the wones she does in class midterms andfinals super easy i got an A- in the class and i barely passed the midterms cause i didnt study wicked classs easy A

Her notes were great, and the final was pretty much the same as the review questions she did in class. Reading the textbook helped with iclicker questions.  Labs are completely pointless and easily finished in 30 min. Open labs were kind of helpful but they were only open 2 days a week

She was okay. She was really friendly and approachable, but her notes weren't very clear, skipped steps, and her notes posted online versus the ones she wrote out during lectures didn't correlate. Her accent made it a bit hard to understand when you sit near the back. But she means well, and I'm sure she's very nice.
amazing prof

Simin simplifies all the topics and makes them easy to understand. She encourages questions.  She is very open if you want to go and ask her anything.  Labs are completely pointless, usually finished within half an hour and are only worth a completion mark (you must complete all or you fail so no choice but to go)

When questions are asked sometimes she answers them but other times she explains something but doesn't actually answer your original question. Hardly ever gives actual definitions, she just explains everything by example. Examples given in class are easy but ones on test sometime have no connection to things learn in class.

She's a very fair teacher.  This was an intro to physics course anyways so the material is Grade 12 level, but the amount of work you must put in should be university level.  Her lecture notes are very simple, but the textbook explains the concepts introduced more.

The majority of her classes were spent doing I clicker questions (worth over 200 marks) and deriving random equations where you'd need knowledge in calculus to know what's going on. Mind you this was a physics 12 class... To be fair she was very accommodating when it came to pushing back due dates but she teaches you nothing for the midterm+final.

She means well and is super accommodating if you have other assignments/exams with similar due dates. Her teaching method is not amazing and she focuses a lot on deriving formulas and overcomplicates a lot of simple concepts. She said she believes that the exams should be easier than the homework. If you do the homework, the class is an easy A/B

She's very nice. But not a teaching style that works for everyone and her notes are often illegible. Most classes are a mix of iclicker questions and her working through problems. Don't expect her to teach you the concepts! Exams are surprisingly easy compared to the sapling (online) questions. Labs are super easy, basically just attendance marks.

He has AMAZING notes! He is super helpful/friendly in office hours, and has no problems explaining tough concepts in multiple different ways. His tests were tough, but very fair if you put in the work. His notes are so detailed, and easy to study from

His lectures are kind of hard to pay attention sometimes as they aren't really "interactive". But the weekly achieve assignments are fairly easy and offer a way to get pratice consistently. Seems to be very passionate about his subject and legitemately tries to make it easy for you to do well in the course.

He is really nice, explains concepts clearly but his classes are a bit boring. He has really good notes, however his lectures feel like he is just reading from them with small demos here and there. The quizzes were tricky, but really prepared you for the tests

Awesome professor, when I ask him questions after lectures he would answer all of them patiently. He is extremely nice, probably the nicest prof I will ever have. His lectures are detailed and notes are all you have to know. Term Test was kind of hard, but final exam was easy. I dislike physics, but he made it a lot better.

Andrew explains concepts very clearly and in class and he really wants everyone to succeed. He is open to any questions that you ask. I struggle with physics but he made the majority of the course easy and purposefully made the final easy because he wants everyone to succeed. The Ta's were also very amazing and helpful! I totally recommend!

Very good prof. I loved how he'd have loads of examples for us and he'd go through each step of them during lecture. I didn't do any practice problems in the textbook all year and still did well on the midterm. I just had the final and it was probably the easiest test I've taken since the start of grade 12, but physics 100 is supposed to be phys 12

The most caring prof i've ever had. He genuinely wants you to do well in the course, and his exams are purely based on understanding the material. His lecture method may not suit a lot of people, though his hand written notes are well written and very thorough with content. All colour coded etc. I'm happy I took physics with prof Andrew.

Andrew was a nice and funny guy and his class is 100% worked examples. As this is an intro course, he went at a reasonable pace and made sure we understood before anything else. His notes had detail but sometimes were a sensory overload LOL. I wish he wrote out his notes or ex. with us bc the class became a sleep-fest with him just talking.

Professor Debenedictis is super kind and helpful, especially during office hours. Physics is not my strong suit but he definitely made it bearable. Notes were super detailed, midterm and final was fair
Absolutely goated, one of if not the best prof I've had so far. Tests and exams were super fair, and was always ready to help students succeed. 10/10 recommend

Listen to him in lectures and do every single step. I'm pretty bad at physics and reading through his worked examples in the notes are very helpful. Sometimes I feel like falling asleep in lec tho. Exams and tests are all symbolic (no numbers) so rearranging formulas properly is very important.
Stay away for the sake of your GPA

It appears to me that there was another category for Simin since her last website on rate my prof was in a 3 range. It also seems that she has boosted this herself. I am here to tell the truth about Simin. Her teaching skills lack. I have self taught most of this semester. I have taken her for Physics 100 and will not make the same mistake again.
Simin was passionate about physics, gave great engaging lectures, easy on grading, and not too much homework. She also had good physical demos and responded to questions well.

this guys doesn't even give out practice exams for midterms or the final! like wtf? His teaching is ok, but he mumbles a lot to himself. He's a nice guy though. Helpful is you approach him. Good demo's in class. I'd give the class a 3/5 stars. I'd give his teaching a 3.5/5 stars. I found the TA's to be more helpful than him.
He always encouraged questions in class and tried his best to answer them. Made the lectures less dry with demos, iclickers and a good sense of humor. I say he is really good!
Honestly got straight to the point and explain everything in perfect detail. Could not recommend a better physics prof. Knows what he is talking about.
I honestly think that he should be teaching a high school course not a university one. Also his accent makes it really hard to understand what he's saying.

All you need to do in Howard's class is to attend the class, and do your masteringphysics exercises. You don't really need to read the textbook. Third mid-term is definitely harder, watch out. there were some people got perfect for the class, they must have physics background which the class doesn't assume!!
Absolutely amazing, and I hate physics
Very enthusiastic!  He likes what he does!
enthusiastic. excellent online notes, my first (and only) A at SFU!

He is the worst teacher I have ever seen. Its too bad. Ive never seen such a bad one. The exam is not taken on the schools website. He has to take the exam on another website. That website is very slow and slow, so I cant log in. , Dont choose his class.

I recommend you to give up, because what he teaches is simple, but not enough to solve the problems he gives. LABS are also some idiotic problems that don't respect students. I said I had a tutor who taught me how to learn physics, but he suspected me of cheating. He would give you a zero, if you didn't answer his questions in detail, why

Just because some people did good in a physics 200 level class, doesn't mean it speaks for everyone. I took physics 100 with him and it was my worst. Avoid him for this course !! He makes it ridiculously tough. Mentioning I did well in highschool physics. Dont just say "I dont know what other people are saying", it's a different course! AVOID

very difficult considering this is a high school equivalent course... his exam questions are nothing like the textbook and he pulls out random questions you have never worked on before. As well, his TAs mark everything. theyre very mean giving back feedback on the exam, and arent helpful. I highly reccomend taking this class with anybody else.

He doesn't teach and just does examples during lecture, and seems to have a hard time putting concepts into words. He expects us to know the material before coming to class by reading the textbook and doesn't explain much. He's very smart, just bad at teaching. As aforementioned, this course should be much lighter considering it's a high school cla

Dodge's lectures are entirely based on answering iClicker questions taken from textbook examples. He doesn't teach and expects you to know everything despite this being a makeup high school physics class. He is obnoxious and very suspicious of students. Don't get involved with him.
He doesn't actually teach, but expects you to know the material already before every class.. avoid if possible especially if your'e not the best with physics
